document_title: Breast cancer recurrence: Signs, causes and prevention
subsection_content:
Recurrent breast cancer occurs when cells that were part of your original breast cancer break away from the original tumor and hide nearby in the breast or in another part of your body. Then these cells start to grow again.
Chemotherapy, biologics, radiation therapy, endocrine therapy, or other treatment you received after your first breast cancer diagnosis is intended to destroy any cancer cells that remain after surgery. But sometimes these treatments cannot kill all of the cancer cells.
Cancer cells can lie dormant for many years without causing harm. Then something happens that activates these cells, which grow and spread to other parts of the body. Current research is unclear as to why this happens.
Cancer recurs in the same location as the original cancer or spreads to other areas.
subsection_title: ung thu vu tai phat.json. Causes of breast cancer recurrence
